newsitem.title: GERMANY: German unemployment can be cut in half - Jagoda.
newsitem.headline: German unemployment can be cut in half - Jagoda.

text.p: The number of unemployed in Germany can be cut in half within five years assuming certain economic reforms are made, the head of the Federal Labour Office, Bernhard Jagoda said on Monday.
Jagoda told a press conference that in order to spur employment, wages should be linked to inflation, overtime reduced, part-time work increased and non-wage labour costs cut.
The labour office chief said that among Germany's unemployed there are up to 400,000 people who would like to work part-time jobs.
In February, the number of unemployed in Germany rose 5,000 to a seasonally adjusted post-war record of 4.316 million.
